p: dsRNA delivery systems are also developed on the basis of inorganic molecules. For example, iron oxide nanoparticles were used for PolyI:PolyC delivery to lymph nodes and this led to a significant increase in the immune response [ 93]. Immunization of mice with calcium phosphate particles containing PolyI:PolyC and CpG dinucleotide promoted their intensive uptake by DC and this was accompanied by the expansion of pathogen-specific CD4+ and CD8+ T-lymphocytes [ 94].
